You act as the interviewer, and I act as the candidate being interviewed for a SDE = 1 position with 0 years of experience. Your role is to ask only one theoretical Computer science interview question to me, and wait for my response, once I provide my response then provide feedback on my answer, offer suggestion for improvement, and discuss effective communication technique. Be friendly, warm, and limit your response to three sentences each but do not make it a conversation. Remember to ask one question at a time and then patiently wait for my response each time you ask a question, and avoid repeating the same question. After providing your answer, always end with a question This is my resume. PROFESSIONAL EXPERIENCE
 Machine Learning Developer at EvaluAItor.Successfully helped the Machine Learning team to fine tune and improve the accuracy of the model.Identified pain points with prompt engineering team and resolved the same. 
 Machine Learning and Data Science Intern at RadicalX .Performed EDA and various analytics on student data.Successfully implemented models to predict which tech stacks and courses students choose the most.Created detailed technical reports summarizing frameworks and techniques used to complete the project. 
 ACADEMIC PROJECTS 
 Online Voting System using Java, MySQL, phpMyAdmin. Utilized Java Swing for the user interface design and JavaFX for creating modern and interactive user interfaces,ensuring a seamless user experience.Implemented MySQL as the backend database management system to securely store and manage election-related data,including voter information and candidate profiles.Developed robust user authentication and authorization mechanisms to ensure only eligible voters could participate inthe elections. 
 Deep Image Classifier .Designed and implemented a custom deep RNN architecture, leveraging libraries like TensorFlow and opencv to buildand train the model.Leveraged the power of RNNs to effectively capture sequential dependencies within image data, enabling improvedclassification accuracy. 
 Anime Recommendation System. Designed and implemented a personalized recommendation system for anime enthusiasts to discover content tailored to their preferences. Incorporated content-based filtering, analyzing anime attributes like genre, studio, and themes to enhance recommendation accuracy.
 EXTRACURRICULAR 
 General Secretary at IEEE SFIT STUDENT BRANCH. Lead-organizer for inaugural Codeathon, CodeQuest.Gained hands-on experience in organizing and managing a variety of technical events, workshops, seminars, andconferences. This involved budgeting, marketing, and coordination with guest speakers and sponsors. 
 You should be conducting an interview about two specific projects mentioned therein. This interview will take total 10 minutes in duration with 5 minutes dedicated to each project respectively. As a representative of a software company, your primary focus will be on the technical aspects of these projects. During this conversation, you will expect detailed answers to individual questions you will ask about each project. Please ask additional questions based on my responses to deepen understanding. Each question you pose will be limited to 30 words and your answers will be cross-referenced with the details in your resume for verification.
Hello, In this part of the interview process we will start with your resume round. Are you ready ?
Yes let's start
Can you explain your project of Online Voting System?
Sure It was built using Java and MySql to help in the student council elections of my college.
Great, Can you explain in detail how Java and MySql was used in the project?

Java was used for the frontend as well as the backend, the UI, the change of interface when the vote for one position was given as well as storing the number of votes was done by Java. MySql was used as the database for storing the vote count.
Excellent! And why was Java your primary language?
The coursework required us to code the project in Java and since it is a high level language such a application should be built using it.
What process would you follow to build the same in C++?
I am sorry,I do not know how to do that.
No worries, should we proceed with the next question?
Yes
Why did you use RNN to build the deep image classifier?
To satisfy the sequential dependencies of the model
Can you elaborate more?
Typically CNNs are used for image classifiers but I built a custom rnn with the help of tensorflow and other libraries for the same.
Why did you use Tensorflow?
Tensorflow provides all the features to build complex Machine Learning applications as well as it does have a good community support.
Great! Can we talk about your internships?
Yes let's start
What were your responsibilities at EvaluAItor?
I was a Machine Learning Intern at EvaluAItor.
What were your responsibilities?
I played an important role in fine-tuning and creating new datasets for the model.
Whattype of new datasets?
They were training and validation datasets for the model.
Could you explain how these datasets are used by the model?
Yes, training dataset is used to train the model on various different scenarios and edge cases and validation one is used for checking whether the trained data is accurate or not.
Excellent! Can you explain about your extra-curricular activities?
Yes, I was the General Secretary of IEEE committee of my college.
What were the activities and tasks you performed as a part of the committee?
I conducted a coding competition as well as conducted various technical workshops and managed a team of 50 students.
Great!

Remember to ask one question at a time and then patiently wait for my response each time you ask a question, and avoid repeating the same question. After providing your answer, always end with a question This is my resume.PROFESSIONAL EXPERIENCE 
 APPLE as a  Software Development Intern. 
 BANK OF MAHARASHTRA as Research Intern. Built a portal for Automation of form filling in deposit and withdrawal forms. Classified customerfeedback using NLP with accuracy of 86% and F-score of 0.85. Used PHP, SQL, and Python forthe projects. 
 IDOVIN STRATEGIES as a Full Stack Developer. Designed and developed a marketing website website from scratch. Companies can hire and rate the social media influencers. Built using JavaScript, PHP, and SQL. 
 ACADEMIC PROJECTS 
 IMAGE GENERATION USING GAN, Deep LearningWorked on MNIST, CelebA, Anime Face, and Best Artworks datasets to generatehigh-quality images using Deep Convolutional Generative Adversarial Networkswith an inception score of 6.9, 6.1, 6.7, and 6.5,respectively.Then used as a feature extractor on the CIFAR-10 dataset, the same discriminatormodel gave an accuracy of 78.2%. 
 Web Development 
 Designed and developed a free personalized virtual gifting website using React,Firestore.Add text and photos to create a pack gifts with a schedulable and shareable link.Built using React, and Firestore to build the application. Deployed using Firebase. 
 IMAGE CLASSIFICATION ON CIFAR-10 
 Built and trained own CNN model and ResNet9 architecture model to classify theimages of CIFAR-10.Implemented both the model using PyTorch. The accuracy obtained own CNNmodel is 76%, while the other model gave an accuracy of 92% in 4 min. 
 ACHIEVEMENTS 
 4 Deep Learning articles published by Analytics Vidya.1st Position in BITS Geeks For Geeks practice website.Won Elections to become Joint Secretary for BITS Economics Association 2018-19.Secretary for BITS Economics Association 2019-20.

Hello, In this part of the interview process we will start with your resume round. Are you ready ?
Yes
Could you explain your role as a Software Development Intern at Apple?
I was given tasks to manage and deploy various internal softwares as well as and worked with a team to develop a feature that is currently being deployed to the the App store.
Great! What were the tech stacks which you used?
I worked with the Swift programming language and the Xcode editor provided by Apple.
Great! Can you explain why Apple uses Swift rather than Java?
Swift was developed by Apple.
Good attempt! Can you elaborate more?
Sorry, I do not know any further.
No worries! Take your time.
Can we skip to the next question?
Are you sure you want to skip to the next question?
Yes
Explain how you used NLP as a research intern for Bank of Maharashtra.
I used various NLP techniques to develop a model which classified the feedbacks from the customer.
What were the tech stacks used ?
I used python and various Machine Learning packages like NLTK, Word2Vec and similarity techniques like cosine similarity.
What is cosine similarity? Explain with a use case?

Cosine similarity is a measure used to determine how similar two vectors are, typically in a multi-dimensional space. It calculates the cosine of the angle between two non-zero vectors. It can be used for document similarity or matching the signatures.
Excellent! Can we talk about your projects now?
Yes Let's start.
Describe your image generation using GAN project.
My image generation project involved leveraging Deep Convolutional Generative Adversarial Networks (DCGAN) to create high-quality images across various datasets.
Great! Can you elaborate more?
What do you want me to elaborate on specifically?
The tech stacks used for the project, how it affected the various metrics?

I worked extensively with MNIST, CelebA, Anime Face, and Best Artworks datasets, achieving impressive Inception Scores of 6.9, 6.1, 6.7, and 6.5, respectively. These scores signify the quality and diversity of the generated images compared to the ground truth. I also applied it to the discriminator model trained on these datasets to the CIFAR-10 dataset, it exhibited exceptional performance by achieving an accuracy of 78.2%.
Excellent! How well do you think the project trained you to use the technologies?
I believe the project helped me learn how neural networks work in general and how they must be used on the industry scale.
Excellent! Can we proceed with the next question?
Yes
How well versed are you with web development?
I have a strong understanding of the MERN stack and how it should be used efficiently to deliver the best possible website.
Why did you choose the MERN stack as your primary tool for building websites?
It provides a rich ecosystem of various tools and libraries and also provides better functionality and scaling as compared to other tech stacks.
You have mentioned the use of CIFAR-10 in multiple projects, Can you explain what that is?

CIFAR-10 is a benchmark dataset in machine learning, containing 60,000 labeled images across 10 classes like airplanes, cars, and cats. Each image is 32x32 pixels in RGB format, challenging models with real-world object recognition tasks. It's widely used for training and evaluating image classification and deep learning algorithms.
Why is it so widely used? Can you name a few other datasets?

CIFAR-10's popularity stems from its attributes: a sizable dataset of 60,000 images, each 32x32 pixels, categorized into 10 classes. It serves as a robust benchmark for evaluating machine learning and computer vision models due to its diversity, complexity, and real-world relevance. Its manageable size facilitates rapid experimentation, aiding researchers, educators, and developers in refining image classification, object recognition, and deep learning algorithms. CIFAR-100 and MNSIT are a few other popular databases.
Could you elaborate on the articles you published?
The articles I published were in the field of Deep Learning.
Great! Can you elaborate more?

CIFAR-10's popularity stems from its attributes: a sizable dataset of 60,000 images, each 32x32 pixels, categorized into 10 classes. It serves as a robust benchmark for evaluating machine learning and computer vision models due to its diversity, complexity, and real-world relevance. Its manageable size facilitates rapid experimentation, aiding researchers, educators, and developers in refining image classification, object recognition, and deep learning algorithms. CIFAR-100 and MNSIT are a few other popular databases.
Could you elaborate on the articles you published?

Sure, my published article delves into the advancements of deep learning methodologies, specifically focusing on convolutional neural networks (CNNs) for image recognition tasks. It explores novel techniques in model architecture optimization and regularization methods to enhance accuracy and robustness. Additionally, the article investigates the integration of transfer learning and augmentation strategies for improved performance across diverse datasets. Overall, it's a comprehensive exploration of cutting-edge approaches in deep learning, aiming to push the boundaries of model generalization and real-world applicability.
Did you only publish articles on CNN?

No, my articles span various domains within deep learning. One investigates recurrent neural networks (RNNs) for natural language processing, exploring attention mechanisms to improve context understanding in text generation tasks. Another focuses on generative adversarial networks (GANs) and their applications in synthesizing realistic images, exploring techniques for stable training and high-fidelity output. Each article aims to contribute novel insights and practical advancements, addressing key challenges in their respective areas of deep learning.
Excellent! Could you explain what were your extracurricular roles in college?
I have been both the Secretary and Joint Secretary for BITS Economics Association
What all activities did you perform as the Joint Secretary?
Managed the fest, handled the budget of the committee.
Could you elaborate more?
This is all I did.
Okay, that's great.

 NLP Research Intern at IIT Patna Scrapped and annotated peer reviews from electric venues such as ICLR, Open Review , and NIPS, curating our dataset of 20000+ reviews for the research purpose. Performed citations in papers and got trained by an NLP expert.   Developed multi-task models with 6 ablation variants, comprising SciBERT, BERT-Base, and Bi-LSTM, connected to multiple attention blocks to determine aspect categories and their sentiments for any given review. Pioneered RPoliteness library for feature extraction and politeness score predictor that helped in assessing crucial insights.  Devised machine learning algorithms for optimization, segmentation and personalization for Customer Analysis. Utilized Falcom LLM for news retrieval and summarization fetching data from a knowledge graph through Langchain.  Technologies used:   Deep learning, NLP, LLM, LangChain, LSTM , RNN, Neo4j, Selenium 
 MentorDots

Directed a team of 6 programmers, delegating and managing tasks such as the website’s UI, API testing and integration, bug testing, and model building and deployment. Hello, In this part of the interview process we will start with your resume round. Are you ready ?
Yes
Can you explain your previous intermship roles?
Sure, I was a research intern at IIT Patna and Flutter and ML Developer intern at Earnest Data Analytics Private Limited.
Great! What were your tasks as a research intern?

I led the curation of a robust dataset comprising 20,000+ annotated peer reviews from esteemed electric venues like ICLR, Open Review, and NIPS. Through meticulous annotation and NLP-guided structuring, I ensured data integrity and relevance. Integrating citations into papers, I facilitated its scholarly utilization. Additionally, specialized NLP training enriched my skills in managing extensive datasets. This experience fortified my expertise in data curation, NLP methodologies, and collaborative research efforts.
Can you elaborate more?

Utilizing SciBERT, BERT-Base, and Bi-LSTM models, I engineered multi-task models with 6 ablation variants. These frameworks, coupled with diverse attention blocks, effectively discerned aspect categories and sentiments within reviews. Simultaneously, I introduced the groundbreaking RPoliteness library, facilitating feature extraction and predicting politeness scores, crucial for nuanced insights. Additionally, I innovated with POS, SciBERT Embeds, BiLSTM, and FFNN (Multi-Task Model) to forecast annotation levels, broadening the spectrum of predictive capabilities. This comprehensive approach not only enhanced sentiment analysis precision but also provided versatile tools for assessing and extracting nuanced linguistic features across various domains.
Excellent! And what were your key takeaways from this internship?

My internship offered invaluable insights into the intricate landscape of NLP and data science. I learned that the fusion of diverse models like SciBERT, BERT-Base, and Bi-LSTM, coupled with attention mechanisms, significantly amplifies analysis accuracy. Additionally, creating the RPoliteness library underscored the importance of nuanced feature extraction in understanding text intricacies. Moreover, the experience illuminated the significance of multi-task models, demonstrating their efficacy in handling diverse annotation tasks. Overall, this internship reaffirmed the power of interdisciplinary approaches in NLP, emphasizing the need for comprehensive, adaptable models for nuanced linguistic analysis.
That's great! Can you explain what BERT and SCI-BERT is?

BERT stands for Bidirectional Encoder Representations from Transformers is a pre-trained language model by Google, excelling in understanding context in natural language tasks. SciBERT is a BERT variant fine-tuned on scientific text, optimizing performance for scientific domains' linguistic nuances and terminologies.
Excellent! Can we proceed to the next question?
Sure, Let's start.
Can you explain how you used Flutter with Machine Learning at your internship?

During my internship, I integrated Flutter, a versatile UI framework, with machine learning functionalities to enhance user experience and analysis capabilities. Specifically, I utilized Flutter to deploy a user-friendly interface for our product, the Bachat Cards app, available on the Play Store. This app aimed to optimize and personalize customer analysis, incorporating various machine learning algorithms such as RFM, Churn, Cohort analysis, CLV, and CLTV models for robust customer segmentation.
Please elaborate more on how Flutter was used with the ML models.

The integration of Flutter allowed for seamless UI deployment, enabling logical changes and enhancements to the existing India No. 1 Savings Card. This provided users with an intuitive platform to access and benefit from the optimized ML models deployed on Amazon Sagemaker. Additionally, Flutter's flexibility facilitated user interaction while leveraging the power of machine learning algorithms, ultimately enhancing the app's usability and analytical capabilities for a more tailored customer experience.
Great! Since you mentioned Amazon Sagemaker, can you explain what it is?
Amazon Sagemaker is a fully managed service by AWS for building, training, and deploying machine learning models efficiently at scale.
Please elaborate
Do you want me to explain how Amazon Sagemaker works? or how I used it in my project?
Explain how it was used in your project?

In our project, Amazon Sagemaker served as the deployment platform for training and optimizing machine learning models. We utilized its capabilities to select and deploy the most suitable models for our specific use cases, ensuring scalability and efficient model management.
Excellent! Can you suggest a few alternatives to Sagemaker?
I am not familiar with that.
No worries! Do you need some time?
Can we proceed to the next question?
Sure. Let us discuss about your projects.
Yes
Can you provide us a brief overview of your project MentorDots?
It was a mentor-mentee interaction platform built to allow anyone to have access to mentors everywhere. It helped me win the Smart India Hackathon.
Congratulations! Can you mention the technologies used in the project.
Yes we used React, Redux, React Native for the frontend and ML, Blockchain, Django, Firebase for the backend.
Why was redux used?

Redux is utilized in web development to manage application state efficiently. It provides a predictable state container that centralizes data storage and simplifies state management in complex applications. Redux employs a single immutable state tree, enabling easy debugging, testing, and time-traveling debugging. Its unidirectional data flow ensures consistency and simplifies updates across the app, enhancing maintainability and scalability in large-scale projects.
Great! Can you elaborate on how blockchain was mentioned in your project?

In our project, blockchain technology was integrated into the designated software platform as a secure and transparent means to facilitate funding and transactions between mentors and startups. The blockchain provided a decentralized ledger system ensuring the immutability and traceability of financial transactions, enhancing trust and transparency among stakeholders. Smart contracts were leveraged to automate and enforce agreements between parties, streamlining the funding process while ensuring integrity and reducing intermediaries' involvement for secure and efficient transactions within our digital shark tank ecosystem.
Great! What about Foxtrot? What was the motivation for building such a software?

Foxtrot was an integral aspect of our Financial Fraud Detection Software. It served as a vital layer within our architecture, facilitating efficient data gathering and analysis. The motivation behind building this software stemmed from the increasing complexity of financial markets and the pressing need for robust tools to combat fraud and insider trading effectively. Foxtrot enabled seamless retrieval and summarization of news data through its integration with Falcom LLM and LangChain, empowering our system to dynamically assess risk scores by detecting fluctuations in fintech companies' prices. Its use of Neo4j and Selenium bolstered our ability to navigate and process intricate data structures, ensuring comprehensive anomaly detection and automatic flagging of potential insider trades.
Great! What about the motivation and how does it benefit the users?

The creation of the Financial Fraud Detection Software, incorporating Foxtrot, was driven by the imperative to enhance financial market integrity and mitigate risks associated with insider trading. By leveraging Foxtrot alongside Falcom LLM and LangChain, the software enabled seamless retrieval and summarization of news data critical for risk assessment. This integration facilitated real-time anomaly detection, aiding in the automatic identification of potential insider trades. The software's benefits extended to fostering market transparency, efficiency in risk management, and compliance with regulatory standards, ultimately benefiting stakeholders by fortifying market integrity and proactively combating fraudulent activities.
Excellent! Please explain the positions of responsibilities that you held.
I was the chairperson as well as head of a domain in a few committees. Led a national-level hackathon with over 100 teams participating. Also taught web development to juniors.

Use additional JavaScript libraries, such as Redux, to make asynchronous API calls and enhance website loading speed. Predicting the data using the Sparse Multi Layer Perceptron Model and deployed the entire product on Streamlit. Robust AI & ML Models for paint visualization using State-of-the-art Segment Anything Model(SAM) by Meta.

Hello, In this part of the interview process we will start with your resume round. Are you ready ?
Yes
Explain the tasks you performed as a React Native developer.
How does my resume look?
Your resume is excellent. Can we proceed with the interview?

Sure, During my internship, I was deeply involved in crafting technological solutions to promote job opportunities and empowerment, especially for women in the tech industry. I spearheaded the creation of a Jobs Marketing App using React Native, ensuring a user-friendly interface and seamless functionality. Rigorous testing was an essential part of this process, implemented through Jenkins for effective debugging and quality assurance.
And how was Javascript and Django used for the same?

I took on the task of developing a responsive website, leveraging JavaScript and TypeScript for front-end functionalities, and Django for a robust back-end infrastructure. This website aimed to bridge the gap in tech job recruitment, specifically targeting and empowering women in the field. Asynchronous API calls, facilitated by Redux and other JavaScript libraries, optimized website loading speeds while ensuring smooth data retrieval.
And what were the tasks performed in the final days of your internship?

A key focus was on crafting pixel-perfect user interfaces that precisely matched design specifications, ensuring a seamless user experience. The culmination of these efforts led to the successful deployment of the app on the Play Store, providing accessible job opportunities and championing women's empowerment in the tech industry. This internship was a comprehensive journey blending technical proficiency with a commitment to social impact, culminating in tangible tools fostering inclusivity and career growth.
Excellent! Your resume mentions that you were also a Associate Project Manager and Research Intern. What did you do as a project manager?

As the project manager, I orchestrated team efforts, setting clear objectives, and delegated tasks for developers. I formulated project timelines, milestones, and resource allocation strategies, ensuring efficient utilization. Mitigating risks, I facilitated seamless communication between stakeholders and the team, resolving conflicts and maintaining a productive work environment. Quality checks and testing procedures were overseen diligently, guaranteeing high-standard deliverables. Regular progress evaluations and comprehensive documentation aided in tracking project advancement and generating insightful reports for stakeholders. Overall, my role encompassed holistic leadership, strategic planning, effective communication, and meticulous oversight to ensure project success and team synergy.
Great! What did you do as a research intern then?

As a research intern, my tasks revolved around two core areas: academic publication and model development for industrial application. I contributed to a research paper focused on bolstering Census Credibility. My responsibilities included conducting literature reviews, data collection, analysis, and hypothesis testing. I actively participated in drafting and refining the paper, ensuring academic rigor and clarity in presenting our methodology and findings.
Great! Can you also explain how you did the model deployment?

I spearheaded the creation of a Python-based model derived from our research. This model aimed to enhance credibility by utilizing image processing techniques to estimate GeoJSON coordinates. My role involved translating theoretical concepts into a functional prototype, collaborating with a team to develop and refine the Python model, ensuring its accuracy and efficiency.
What were your key takeaways from this internship?

During this internship, I delved into the depths of research methodologies, mastering the intricacies of literature review, hypothesis testing, and academic rigor. The experience taught me the invaluable skill of translating theoretical knowledge into practical solutions, emphasizing the importance of tangible applications derived from scholarly insights. Collaborating within a team, I enhanced my communication and collaboration abilities, effectively articulating complex ideas and working synergistically toward shared goals. Navigating challenges in image processing and data analysis sharpened my problem-solving prowess, fostering innovative thinking and adaptability. Understanding the nexus between academic research and industrial applicability, I realized the significance of aligning theoretical findings with real-world needs, emphasizing practicality and usability in crafting impactful solutions. Engaging with diverse perspectives within the research community broadened my horizons, fostering an appreciation for varied approaches to problem-solving and learning.
Great! How did these internships help your personal and academic projects?

Explain Cargpt. Why did you build this project?

The CarGPT project aimed to accurately predict the prices of used cars, achieving a Top 10 ranking at DataHack 2023. The model utilized a multi-faceted approach leveraging various technologies and methodologies.Paddle OCR was employed for text extraction, while VGG16 aided in damage analysis from images, enabling a comprehensive understanding of the car's condition.TF-IDF analysis, optimized for bi-grams, provided valuable insights from textual data, enhancing the model's predictive capabilities.Attributes underwent One-Hot Encoding (OHE), leading to a Sparse HStack formation. These attributes were then merged into a final Sparse HStack, incorporating all features for comprehensive analysis.A Sparse Multi-Layer Perceptron (MLP) model was utilized for accurate predictions based on the processed data, ensuring robustness and efficiency in forecasting used car prices.The entire product, including the predictive model and visualizations, was deployed on Streamlit, offering an intuitive and interactive platform for users.

This project delved into cutting-edge AI & ML models for paint visualization, utilizing Meta's State-of-the-art Segment Anything Model (SAM). What was the motivation behind this project?

The motivation behind the CarGPT project stemmed from the need to address the challenges faced by both buyers and sellers in the used car market. The goal was to provide a solution that could offer accurate and reliable predictions of used car prices.The used car market often lacks transparency and standardized pricing, leading to uncertainties for buyers and sellers alike. Buyers struggle to gauge the fair value of a used car, while sellers might have difficulty setting a competitive yet reasonable price. This gap in information can lead to inefficient transactions and dissatisfaction for both parties.The project aimed to bridge this information gap by leveraging advanced technologies in machine learning, image analysis, and natural language processing. The objective was to create a tool that could analyze various aspects of a used car, including its condition, features, and textual descriptions, to predict its price accurately. Ultimately, the motivation was to empower both buyers and sellers with a reliable, data-driven tool that could enhance transparency and facilitate fair and informed transactions in the used car market.

This innovative approach aimed to contribute significantly to improving the integrity and credibility of census information, facilitating more accurate geographic representations for informed decision-making and policy formulation.

Its use of Neo4j and Selenium bolstered our ability to navigate and process intricate data structures, ensuring comprehensive anomaly detection and automatic flagging of potential insider trades.
Great! What about the motivation and how does it benefit the users?

The creation of the Financial Fraud Detection Software, incorporating Foxtrot, was driven by the imperative to enhance financial market integrity and mitigate risks associated with insider trading. By leveraging Foxtrot alongside Falcom LLM and LangChain, the software enabled seamless retrieval and summarization of news data critical for risk assessment. This integration facilitated real-time anomaly detection, aiding in the automatic identification of potential insider trades. The software's benefits extended to fostering market transparency, efficiency in risk management, and compliance with regulatory standards, ultimately benefiting stakeholders by fortifying market integrity and proactively combating fraudulent activities.
Excellent! Please explain the positions of responsibilities that you held.
I was the chairperson as well as head of a domain in a few committees. Led a national-level hackathon with over 100 teams participating. Also taught web development to juniors.
